name: Kaiser Chiefs
description:
'''Kaiser Chiefs''' are an English [[indie rock]] band from [[Leeds]] who originally formed in 1996 as '''Runston Parva''', before reforming as '''Parva''' in 2000, and releasing one studio album, ''22'', in 2003, before renaming and establishing themselves in their current name that same year. Since their formation, the band has consisted of lead vocalist [[Ricky Wilson (singer)|Ricky Wilson]], [[guitarist]] [[Andrew White (musician)|Andrew "Whitey" White]], bassist Simon Rix, keyboardist Nick "Peanut" Baines and since 2013 drummer Vijay Mistry, who replaced founding drummer [[Nick Hodgson]] following his departure from the band in late 2012.

Primarily inspired by [[New wave music|new wave]] and [[punk rock]] music of the late 1970s and 1980s, the band has released eight original studio albums: ''[[Employment (album)|Employment]]'' (2005), ''[[Yours Truly, Angry Mob]]'' (2007), ''[[Off with Their Heads (album)|Off with Their Heads]]'' (2008), ''[[The Future Is Medieval]]'' (2011), ''[[Education, Education, Education & War]]'' (2014),  [[Stay Together (album)|''Stay Together'']] (2016), ''[[Duck (album)|Duck]]'' (2019), and ''[[Kaiser Chiefs' Easy Eighth Album]]'' (2024), one EP: ''[[Lap of Honour]]'' (2005), one compilation album: ''[[Souvenir: The Singles 2004â€“2012]]'' (2012) and numerous singles, including the number one hit song "[[Ruby (Kaiser Chiefs song)|Ruby]]".

Their album ''Employment'' enjoyed critical and commercial success with over three million copies sold. It has won the band three [[Brit Awards]], including the award for Best British Group, a NME award for Best Album, and was shortlisted for the [[Mercury Prize]].

Their UK hit singles include 2004 and 2005 number 9 hit "[[I Predict a Riot]]", 2007 UK number 1 hit "[[Ruby (Kaiser Chiefs song)|Ruby]]", which has sold over 461,000 copies, from their platinum album ''[[Yours Truly, Angry Mob]]'' plus a further two Top 20 singles in 2007 with "[[The Angry Mob]]" and "[[Everything Is Average Nowadays]]". Their singles "[[Ruby (Kaiser Chiefs song)|Ruby]]", "[[I Predict a Riot]]", "[[Everyday I Love You Less and Less]]", "[[Never Miss a Beat]]" and "[[Oh My God (Kaiser Chiefs song)|Oh My God]]" had sold a combined total of 1.1 million up to August 2012.
